critique: This document is an executive order that exempts John P. Dunlop, an economic analyst, from compulsory retirement for one year. It cites the public interest and the authority vested in the president by a specific act. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The only axis that seems relevant is executive power, as the order utilizes presidential authority to make an exception to a retirement rule. However, this seems like a fairly standard use of executive power within established legal boundaries, so I will mark it as neutral.
